image.altText: Portrait of a man against mountain ranges at sunset

props.synopsis: David Crust, who oversees the management of a million hectares of the Blue Mountains, says he's never seen the level of destruction wrought by the elements over the past five years.

title.children: Boom in nature tourism is increasing safety challenges for Blue Mountains, parks boss say

image.altText: a woman putting a voting ballot paper in a box

props.synopsis: Council elections are taking place in NSW on September 14. Here's what you need to know before, during and after the polling booths open.

title.children: From pre-polling to voting fines: What you need to know about the NSW council elections

image.altText: Mother and child hug anonymous generic

props.synopsis: Amber feared her daughter was being sexually abused by her ex. A family court judge said she was projecting her own experiences onto her daughter, and she lost custody.

title.children: Amber's sister made a 'malicious' report to child safety about her parenting. It found its way into her family court case

image.altText: Jim Chalmers wears a navy suit, looking solemnly off camera.

props.synopsis: With the national accounts this week showing the economy barely registering a pulse, more oxygen was expended on accusing the treasurer of being mean to the Reserve Bank than on what is happening in the economy.

title.children: Instead of studying the tectonic shifts of the economy, we're burning oxygen on the treasurer being 'mean' to the RBA

image.altText: A composite image of a broadcasting tower with a sign reading "ten" and an image of a woman with blonde hair smiling.

props.synopsis: Network Ten reporter Tegan George's bid to sue her employer over trauma she says she suffered covering the bushfire season in 2019 and 2020 ends in a confidential settlement.

title.children: Network Ten reporter Tegan George reaches settlement with broadcaster over bushfire trauma

image.altText: A map showing Muswellbrook NSW.

props.synopsis: The Seismology Research Centre has recorded a magnitude-4.5 earthquake near Muswellbrook.

title.children: Earthquake hits NSW Hunter Region weeks after two similar events

image.altText: image of Israeli tank operating in Gaza

props.synopsis: The controversial "Hannibal Directive", which Israel says isn't named for the famous Carthaginian general who took poison rather than be captured by the Romans, was reportedly enacted after the October 7 Hamas attack, with revelations detailing attacks by IDF tanks and helicopters on homes and vehicles returning to Gaza.

title.children: In the chaos of the attack on Israel, did the IDF invoke the controversial, mysterious 'Hannibal Directive'?

image.altText: Donald Trump has a serious expression.

props.synopsis: A New York judge postpones Donald Trump's sentencing for his "hush money" crimes until after the upcoming US election.

title.children: Trump's sentencing in porn star 'hush money' case delayed until after election

image.altText: Elle Macpherson walks the runway for Ngali during the Melbourne Fashion Festival

props.synopsis: Not all voices carry in the same way; not everyone has clout: Macpherson does, and while she is right to say that she's entitled to tell her story, it's also true that it's dangerous to shout "fire" in a crowded theatre.

title.children: Elle is entitled to tell her cancer story. But it's also dangerous to shout 'fire' in a crowded theatre

image.altText: An FBI police vehicle

props.synopsis: US law enforcement officials says the 20-year-old Pakistan national "planned a terrorist attack in New York City around October 7th of this year with the stated goal of slaughtering, in the name of ISIS, as many Jewish people as possible".

title.children: Man charged with plotting mass shooting at US Jewish centre on anniversary of Hamas attack

image.altText: A man wearing glasses and dressed in a suit speaks into a microphone.

props.synopsis: It began with an argument between Coalition colleagues, Wes Fang and Natalie Ward, an ended with Mr Fang taking a swipe at the Liberal leader before being removed from a hearing in NSW parliament.

title.children: MP booted from parliamentary hearing after bickering with Coalition colleague

image.altText: Robert Ovadia wearing a suit with a tie

props.synopsis: The veteran journalist had taken his former employer to the Federal Court after an internal investigation into allegations of "inappropriate behaviour" that led to his sacking in June.

title.children: Sacked journalist Robert Ovadia drops case against Seven Network for 'personal reasons'

image.altText: Perth Mint gold

props.synopsis: Gold has been relentlessly surging to new records. So what's behind the recent demand?

title.children: Why gold is surging and what it tells us about global stability

image.altText: A sign above the entrance to a hospital building which says 'the children's hospital at Westmead'.

props.synopsis: An independent review into gender-affirming care for children finds research still supports puberty suppression treatment as "safe, effective and reversible" but calls for more long-term quality studies.

title.children: Puberty blockers 'safe, effective and reversible', finds review triggered by Westmead Hospital investigation

image.altText: Dr Saul Karnovsky in his office at Curtin University in Perth looking and writing notes.

props.synopsis: An education researcher warns burnout is driving teachers out of the profession in droves and staff shortages in schools across the country next year will be far worse than authorities are predicting.

title.children: 'It's basically having no life': Teachers leaving schools in droves due to burnout

image.altText: Punters play on the poker machines at the Locomotive Hotel during the Tamworth Country Music Festival

props.synopsis: The NSW government's long-promised cashless gaming trial was taken up by 207 people, but just 32 remain as "active" users.

title.children: Major trial to reduce gambling harm in NSW has just 32 'active' users

image.altText: Ben Hance celebrates breaking his world record at Paris Paralympics.

props.synopsis: Ben Hance defends his Paralympic crown from Tokyo, as 17-year-old Callum Simpson announced himself on the world stage with his first individual gold medal.

title.children: Hance and Simpson win gold as Aussie swimmers collect seven medals in the pool

image.altText: A man walking down a street wearing a black t shirt

props.synopsis: George Alex was supposed to appear in court today after being found guilty over a $10 million ATO fraud but he was instead in rehab being treated for an opioid addiction.

title.children: Sydney construction boss in custody after failing to attend court over $10m scam

image.altText: A composite image showing Wayne Swan handing down the budget in 2008 and Jim Chalmers handing down this budget.

props.synopsis: Labor frustrations with Jim Chalmers's mild-mannered, hand-picked RBA governor spilled into the open this week.

title.children: A pair of Labor treasurers delivered a one-two 'punch' to the RBA this week. It was a strategy, not an accident.

image.altText: Rainbow Flag

props.synopsis: The 2026 census questions on gender and sexual orientation that have been at the centre of a political brawl for the past week have been revealed to the ABC.

title.children: LGBTQI+ questions scrapped from census revealed

image.altText: tourists taking pictures of kangaroo

props.synopsis: Dozens of kangaroos have set up home in a residential area south of Newcastle, attracting a wave of tourists and prompting warnings about potential attacks.

title.children: Fears of attacks as unruly roos take over coastal NSW community

image.altText: Toddler in jumpsuit

props.synopsis: Jordan Thompson died with a toxic amount of an antidepressant in his system, which the Crown alleges his mother's then-partner put in in his drink. The accused denies the allegation.

title.children: Jury hears man accused of killing toddler had chance to put antidepressants in chocolate milk

image.altText: man with shirt on head

props.synopsis: Nathan Bernhard pleaded not guilty to dangerous and negligent driving charges after he allegedly drove over two men he had been drinking with in May last year.

title.children: Man accused of running over and killing two men while drink-driving to face trial

image.altText: two women laughing as they take a selfie outdoors at the 2023 bluesfest music festival in byron bay

props.synopsis: A report commissioned by organisers of the Byron Bay festival paints a picture of what the region stands to lose without the event, which is set to wrap up next year.

title.children: As the end looms for Bluesfest, data shows the 2024 event pumped $230 million into the NSW economy

image.altText: Three antique firearms lie on top of a black case.

props.synopsis: Arrests have been made over the theft of historical handguns worth more than $200,000 from the Lithgow Small Arms Factory Museum.

title.children: Police arrest three arrested over weapons museum theft but 14 handguns still missing

image.altText: A man at a cash register.

props.synopsis: With freight adding up to 50 per cent to their cost of living, Lord Howe Islanders find ways to manage the price of living in paradise.

title.children: The price of living in paradise, where a small jar of coffee is $17, rice is $9 per kilo and petrol's $4 per litre

image.altText: Man smiles in wheelchair looking up at basketball ring.

props.synopsis: Gold medallist Gerry Hewson has established five regional wheelchair basketball clubs this year and has plans for eight more. It's all part of his plan to set Australia up for glory before the Brisbane Paralympics in 2032.

title.children: Four-time Paralympian shuns the big smoke in hunt for next wave of wheelchair basketball stars

image.altText: Patchy snow slope with mounds of dirt dotted through it

props.synopsis: Tourism operators and the broader Snowy Mountains region are looking to summer tourism options as they face the prospect of warmer winters and shorter ski seasons.

title.children: This year's ski season ended far earlier than usual, prompting soul-searching among operators

image.altText: A man with large glasses smiles gently in front of a city skyline

props.synopsis: Sydney has "very few" councillors with disabilities, but Daniel McDonald wants to change that at this upcoming local election.

title.children: Artist vies to become one of Sydney's first councillors living with deafness

image.altText: Donald Trump has a serious expression.

props.synopsis: A New York judge postpones Donald Trump's sentencing for his "hush money" crimes until after the upcoming US election.

title.children: Trump's sentencing in porn star 'hush money' case delayed until after election

image.altText: Perth Mint gold

props.synopsis: Gold has been relentlessly surging to new records. So what's behind the recent demand?

title.children: Why gold is surging and what it tells us about global stability

image.altText: A man with a beard stands in front of the Australian War Memorial and looks into the camera.

props.synopsis: In the past two weeks, more than 200 current and former service personnel have pledged their brains to the Australian Veterans Brain Bank, after the ABC reported growing evidence of a link between mild traumatic brain injury associated with blast exposure and poor mental health and suicide.

title.children: Khalil served 34 years in the military. He has pledged his brain to science to help other veterans

image.altText: A composite image showing Wayne Swan handing down the budget in 2008 and Jim Chalmers handing down this budget.

props.synopsis: Labor frustrations with Jim Chalmers's mild-mannered, hand-picked RBA governor spilled into the open this week.

title.children: A pair of Labor treasurers delivered a one-two 'punch' to the RBA this week. It was a strategy, not an accident.

props.synopsis: The controversial "Hannibal Directive", which Israel says isn't named for the famous Carthaginian general who took poison rather than be captured by the Romans, was reportedly enacted after the October 7 Hamas attack, with revelations detailing attacks by IDF tanks and helicopters on homes and vehicles returning to Gaza.

title.children: The mysterious Israeli directive that might have cost lives during the country’s darkest day
